channel.title: Run.bat need help to get it working on Linux Debian 7
channel.description:
ok I have all of the files on my Linux server the problem is the run .sh will not work server revision = 667
this is the run.bat code @echo off title runserver java -Xmx1400m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause
if anyone could please fix it and post a reply it would help a lot :/ im sorry im kinda new to Linux and the tutorials are not helping me much please help me please :/

item.title: Run.bat need help to get it working on Linux Debian 7
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

As long as you’re using Java 6+ you can use wildcards directly in the classpath. Just make sure to encapsulate in a string so bash doesn’t try and interpret it.

Read full topic
item.source: Run.bat need help to get it working on Linux Debian 7

item.title: Run.bat need help to get it working on Linux Debian 7

item.description:
@thezohanx wrote:

ok I have all of the files on my Linux server the problem is the run .sh will not work
server revision = 667

this is the run.bat code
@echo off
title runserver
java -Xmx1400m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false
pause

if anyone could please fix it and post a reply it would help a lot im sorry im kinda new to Linux and the tutorials are not helping me much please help me please
